chapter.title: Building Thumper
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to build Thumper and its associated documentation. The tools with specific version numbers shown below are the official tools used by the Thumper contributors. Other tools (or other versions of the same tools) may also work. Obviously the greater the differences between the tools you attempt to use and those listed below the more trouble you are likely to encounter during the build process.
Two versions of the Thumper server exist. One is written in SPARK and the other is written in Haskell. The Thumper client is not under active development at this time.

section.title: SPARK Build
section.para: In this section the tools needed to build and test the SPARK version of Thumper are described. If you are interested in only the Haskell version of Thumper you can skip to the following section.

listitem.para: We use the GNAT GPL 2012 Ada compiler from AdaCore. It can be used freely for open source projects such as Thumper. Thumper makes use of some GNAT-specific libraries that are bundled with GNAT but that might not be available with another Ada compiler. These libraries are contained in package GNAT and its child packages.
We use the SPARK GPL 2012 tools to verify the integrity of the Thumper server.
We use the GPS integrated development environment that comes with GNAT GPL 2012 as our IDE. GPS is able to integrate both Ada development and SPARK analysis.
The Thumper test program makes use of the AUnit unit testing framework. AUnit is maintained by AdaCore and can be downloaded from the same site as GNAT GPL.

The documentation is written in DocBook. It is an XML format and so is readable in an ordinary text editor. However, if you want to build nicely formatted documentation you will need a tool chain for processing DocBook documents. Several such tool chains exist. This document does not discuss the options any further.

section.para: To build Thumper install the components listed above and check out the latest Thumper source code from GitHub by cloning the URL . Once you have a working copy of the project load the project file Ada/thumper.gpr into GPS. You will find the main files thumper_server.adb and thumper_client.adb. Build these files to generate the server and client programs respectively. Note that at the time of this writing the client program is only a skeleton.
To test Thumper, build the main file thumper_test.adb. Executing the resulting program will run all the unit tests and produce a report of the results on the console.
